Family event
Value: Father came in in a drunken stupor and abused her

Heading: Head injury?
Value: Yes- 1) Coma after car accident/suicide attempt; 2) slipped and hit head in the doorway; 3) Quoted saying, “[…] had a lot of falls hitting my head.” 4) Father hit her in the head with a metal can of antifreeze

Heading: Sexually abused?
Value: Yes, by father and family friend

Heading: Highest grade in school
Value: Graduated from Fort Payne High School in 1976

Heading: Applied for job as a cop?
Types of jobs worked
Value: Worked at a motel, then as an assistant administrator at a nursing home

Heading: Number of children
Value: 2nd husband had two children, but none of her own

Heading: Living with
Value: Her partners/lovers at the time of their relationship

Heading: Animal torture
Value: Possibly. Accounts of killing a dog, rabbit, and fish. She also hoarded rabbits and had an obsession with them.

Heading: Been to a psychologist (prior to killing)?
Time in forensic hospital (prior to killing)?
Value: Yes- 30 days in a psychiatric ward after an apparent suicide attempt

Heading: Diagnosis
Value: According to Sheila’s sister, there had been no psychiatric exams between the time she was hospitalized and her arrest for murder (25 years)

Heading: Killer Criminal History (Prior to the series)
Committed previous crimes?
Value: Yes- felony counts of 2nd degree assault

Heading: Victim type
Value: Men, people she perceived to be “pedophiles”

Date of first kill in series
Date of final kill in series
Type of victim
Value: Men she perceived to be submissive; pedophiles

Heading: Location of first contact
Value: She met her victims through personal ads

Killing occurred in home of killer?
Victim abducted or killed at contact?

Value: No but did have sex with them

Heading: Left at scene, no attempt to hide
Date convicted
Value: Formally indicted- September 18, 2006; Found guilty and sane- June 20, 2008

Heading: Sentence
Value: 2 life sentences, no possibility of parole

Heading: Did serial killer confess?
Value: Confessed but claimed not legally responsible because of insanity
